data.title: Washington Nationals Manager Dave Martinez Headlines First Pitch Dinner
data.meta_description: FAIRFAX, Va. – George Mason Athletics will host its annual First Pitch Dinner, presented by Sandy Spring Bank on Friday, Jan. 24 at the Country Club of Fairfax,
data.text:
Share:

Baseball 12/12/2019 11:39:00 AM

FAIRFAX, Va. – George Mason Athletics will host its annual First Pitch Dinner, presented by Sandy Spring Bank on Friday, Jan. 24 at the Country Club of Fairfax, featuring Dave Martinez, manager of the Washington Nationals.

Martinez guided the Nationals to the 2019 World Series championship, the first in franchise history. Washington finished the regular season in second place in the National League East with a 93-69 record and went 12-5 in postseason play.

The Nationals defeated the Houston Astros four games to three to win the World Series. The road team won every game in the series for the first time in World Series history.

The 2020 season will mark his 32th in professional baseball, including spending the last two years as the manager of the Nationals.

Martinez served as the bench coach for the Chicago Cubs from 2015-17 where he played an integral role in three postseason appearances, two National League Central division titles and the Cubs' 2016 World Series Championship.

Prior to joining the Cubs, Martinez spent seven seasons as the bench coach for the Tampa Bay Rays and was the longest tenured bench coach in club history.

A veteran of 16 Major League seasons, Martinez played 1,918 games and finished with 1,599 hits and a .276 batting average while playing for nine clubs during his career. He broke into the big leagues with the Chicago Cubs in 1986 at the age of 21 and was the 10th-youngest player to appear in Major League Baseball during the season.

"We are honored to have Dave Martinez return as our special guest and keynote speaker at the 2020 First Pitch Dinner," Mason baseball head coach Bill Brown said. "It is exciting that he will be spending the evening of Jan. 24 with us sharing his insight on the Nationals World Series Championship and his incredibly accomplished professional baseball career."

An MVP Table for the event can be purchased for $3,000 and includes six tickets, entry to an MVP reception with Dave Martinez, silent auction, dinner, seating with two members of the 2020 Mason baseball team and names listed in the event program.

Table sponsorship is available for $2,000 and includes six tickets, entry to social hour, silent auction, dinner, seating with two members of the 2020 Mason baseball team and names listed in the event program.

General individual tickets can be purchased for $250, Baseball Alumni and Young Alumni (undergraduate degree holders of the last five years) for $200 and the cost for youth 12 and under is $50. All tickets include entry to the social hour, silent auction and dinner. The MVP reception begins at 6 p.m., followed by the social hour at 6:30 p.m. and dinner at 7:30 p.m.

"What a fantastic experience for the players, alumni, friends of Mason Baseball and the entire baseball community to have the opportunity to hear from the man who led the Washington Nationals to the 2019 World Series Championship," Brown said. "Our thanks to Dave Martinez for agreeing to be part of what will be an incredibly special evening for the Mason Baseball program, our athletic department and George Mason University."

For more information, contact LeeAnn Bushar at lbushar@gmu.edu or 703-993-4147. Proceeds support the Mason Baseball program.
